skill.description: Use when the user asks why something happened, what‚Äôs wrong, root cause analysis, debugging, or incident explanation.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No code execution, file system access, network calls, or external commands. The skill defines operational rules for diagnostic reasoning without any executable components.

content.value_statement: Users often need to understand why something failed but receive solutions instead of explanations. This skill provides structured diagnostic reasoning to identify and rank likely causes based on observed symptoms.
actual_capabilities: Restate symptoms and scope of problems clearly
Generate multiple plausible hypotheses for causes
Explain the mechanism behind each hypothesis
Rank hypotheses by likelihood and impact
Identify missing data needed to confirm causes
Distinguish between diagnosis and prescriptive fixes
limitations: Does not provide solutions or fixes - use prescriptive-action instead
Does not create plans or procedures - use planning-action instead
Requires user to provide clear symptom descriptions
Cannot access external systems or logs directly

use_cases.title: Debug production incidents
use_cases.description: Analyze error messages and system behavior to identify root causes of bugs or outages

use_cases.title: Troubleshoot user issues
use_cases.description: Determine why users experience specific problems and what conditions caused them

use_cases.title: Investigate process failures
use_cases.description: Understand why business processes failed and what factors contributed to the outcome

prompt_templates.title: Basic Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Why did [specific event] happen? The symptoms were [describe symptoms] affecting [scope of impact].

prompt_templates.title: System Debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: Diagnose why [system/component] failed. Observed behavior: [description]. Error context: [relevant logs or info].

prompt_templates.title: Incident Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform root cause analysis for [incident description]. What are the most likely causes ranked by probability? What evidence supports each?

prompt_templates.title: Process Failure Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Investigate why [process] produced [undesirable outcome]. Consider contributing factors, dependencies, and root mechanisms.

output_examples.input: Why did the deployment fail last night? The build passed but the service did not start.
output: Symptoms: Build passed successfully, but service failed to start after deployment
‚Ä¢ Environment mismatch - likely cause (confidence: 85%) - Build environment differs from production; mechanism: missing production config or secrets
‚Ä¢ Dependency conflict - possible cause (confidence: 60%) - New version has incompatible dependency; mechanism: transitive dependency conflict
‚Ä¢ Resource constraint - less likely (confidence: 30%) - Production lacks sufficient resources; mechanism: memory or CPU limits
Most likely cause: Environment mismatch is primary suspect
Data needed: Compare environment variables, check deployment logs, verify config files match production

best_practices: Provide specific symptom descriptions including error messages, timestamps, and affected components
Define clear scope: what is affected and what is working normally
Ask for missing evidence rather than guessing with low confidence
anti_patterns: Jumping to solutions without fully understanding the problem first
Prescribing fixes when the user only asked for diagnosis
Providing single cause without considering multiple hypotheses

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all AI assistants?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Some prompting styles may vary slightly between platforms.

faq.question: What limits does this skill have?
faq.answer: Cannot access external systems or logs. Requires user-provided symptom information. Does not generate fixes.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with other skills?
faq.answer: Use diagnostic-action first to understand causes, then follow with prescriptive-action for solutions or planning-action for implementation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why did my diagnosis fail?
faq.answer: Check that you provided clear symptom descriptions and scope. Vague problem statements lead to generic hypotheses.

faq.question: How is this different from troubleshooting guides?
faq.answer: This skill generates reasoning-specific hypotheses rather than following predetermined scripts. It adapts to unique situations.
